content:
• Tuesday, March 20, 2012
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore (NASDAQ:HERO) says it plans to sell 20M shares of stock and $500M of debt in a...

    Hercules Offshore (NASDAQ:HERO) says it plans to sell 20M shares of stock and $500M of debt in a private placement. The offshore- drilling company plans to use the proceeds to repay all outstanding debt under its existing term loan, as well as fund a new rig acquisition. Shares -2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:45 PM
  • OMN

    More on Omnova (NYSE:OMN): Q4 easily beats on a per share basis as profit soared due to pricing...

    More on Omnova (NYSE:OMN): Q4 easily beats on a per share basis as profit soared due to pricing actions, an improved sales mix of higher margin products, benefits from its global manufacturing footprint and continued productivity improvements. Shares +20% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM
  • FSII

    More on FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII): FQ2 easily beat across the board despite a drop in net...

    More on FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII): FQ2 easily beat across the board despite a drop in net earnings due to rising costs and higher expenses. Revenue actually jumped 25% Y/Y, as orders more than doubled amid broader adoption of some of its main products. The company also gave an upbeat forecast for the current quarter, now expecting Q3 revenue to exceed $50M. The Street consensus is at $36.3M. Shares +13.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • ASGN

    On Assignment (NASDAQ:ASGN) +20.6% AH after announcing it will merge with rival Apex Systems to...

    On Assignment (NASDAQ:ASGN) +20.6% AH after announcing it will merge with rival Apex Systems to form the #2 IT staffing firm in the U.S. On Assignment, which closed with a market cap of $504M, will "acquire" Apex for $383M in cash and $217M in newly-issued stock. The cash will come from a new $540M credit facility. The combined company is expected to have 2H revenue of $775M-$805M and EPS of $0.77-%0.87.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • OMN

    Omnova Solutions (NYSE:OMN): FQ1 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $276M (+1.5% Y/Y)...

    Omnova Solutions (NYSE:OMN): FQ1 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $276M (+1.5% Y/Y) misses by $16M. Shares +14.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate (LGF +7.2%), which soared to new highs today, rises 3.1% AH after comments from vice...

    Lions Gate (LGF +7.2%), which soared to new highs today, rises 3.1% AH after comments from vice chairman Michael Burns further stoke high expectations related to Friday's release of The Hunger Games. Burns also says Lions Gate intends to slash its debt; the company had $1.06B of debt on its balance sheet as of Dec. 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • AMZN

    Though it opened lower, Amazon (AMZN +3.7%) finished the day with a solid gain, as analysts...

    Though it opened lower, Amazon (AMZN +3.7%) finished the day with a solid gain, as analysts rushed to praise its acquisition of Kiva (I, II). Goldman and JPMorgan note the potential of Kiva's technology to put a lid on Amazon's soaring headcount and fulfillment expenses, and UBS, which believes Kiva generated $100M in 2011 revenue, thinks the deal should be accretive going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) guides on its FQ3 call (webcast) for FQ4 revenue growth of -2% to +2% and EPS...

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) guides on its FQ3 call (webcast) for FQ4 revenue growth of -2% to +2% and EPS of $0.76-$0.81 (no forex adjustments); the former is below a consensus for 3.4% growth, while the latter is largely above a $0.76 consensus. New software license revenue growth is expected to be -2% to +8% Y/Y. Hardware revenue, which was down sharply in FQ3, is expected to be flat to up $100M-$110M Q/Q. ORCL now +0.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARIA) -1.7% AH after an FDA panel votes13-1 not to recommend...

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARIA) -1.7% AH after an FDA panel votes13-1 not to recommend Taltorvic, a sarcoma drug developed by Ariad and Merck (NYSE:MRK). The panel concluded Taltorvic's short-term benefits fail to "outweigh the risks of adverse reactions and a lack of evidence of improved overall survival." A rival drug from GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) received a thumbs-up earlier today. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • KKD

    More on Krispy Kreme's FQ4: Fueled by growing beverage sales, company and domestic franchise...

    More on Krispy Kreme's FQ4: Fueled by growing beverage sales, company and domestic franchise same-store sales respectively rose 8.3% and 7.9% Y/Y. However, international franchise same-store sales fell a currency-adjusted 9.3%. The company is reaffirming guidance for FY13 EPS of $0.35-$0.41 ($0.35 consensus). It now expects to open 75 international franchises in FY13, up from a prior 60. KKD +5.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • LDOS

    More on SAIC (SAI): Q4 misses on all counts due to a $308M loss provision for its CityTime...

    More on SAIC (SAI): Q4 misses on all counts due to a $308M loss provision for its CityTime settlement. The company also issues mixed guidance, saying it now expects FY13 EPS to be around $1.26 - $1.36 on revenues of $10.7B - $11.2B. The Street view is for an EPS of $1.38 on revenues of $10.71B. Additionally, the company declares a $0.12 quarterly dividend payment. Shares -2.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • ORCL

    More on Oracle's FQ3: New software license revenue, a closely-watched figure, rose 7% Y/Y, up...

    More on Oracle's FQ3: New software license revenue, a closely-watched figure, rose 7% Y/Y, up from FQ2's 2% increase. License update/support revenue rose 8%, and services revenue was flat. Hardware remains weak, down 11% overall thanks to a 16% drop in systems sales. The drop comes in spite of a 139% increase in sales of engineered systems, which suggests sales of older UNIX servers are in freefall. ORCL +2.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • JBL

    More on Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ2 beats on both a per share an revenue basis, and adds that...

    More on Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ2 beats on both a per share an revenue basis, and adds that its FQ3 EPS will likely bracket estimates. It now expects to earn between $0.60 - $0.70 per share. Consensus estimates are for an EPS of $0.65. Shares -2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • CTAS

    Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS): FQ3 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.01B (+7.8% Y/Y) in-line....

    Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS): FQ3 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $1.01B (+7.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD): Q4 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $102M (+11.2% Y/Y)...

    Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD): Q4 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $102M (+11.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • FSII

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII): FQ2 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $38.5M (+25% Y/Y)...

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII): FQ2 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $38.5M (+25% Y/Y) beats by $6.5M. Shares +10.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI): Q4 EPS of $0.31 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $2.49B (-8.5% Y/Y) misses by $180M....

    SAIC (SAI): Q4 EPS of $0.31 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $2.49B (-8.5% Y/Y) misses by $180M. Shares -4.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • JBL

    Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ2 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $4.2B (+7.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ2 EPS of $0.58 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $4.2B (+7.8% Y/Y) beats by $150M. Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL): FQ3 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $9B (+3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL): FQ3 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $9B (+3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.7%) jumps in afternoon trading thanks to a DealBook report claiming Alibaba's...

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.7%) jumps in afternoon trading thanks to a DealBook report claiming Alibaba's (OTC:ALBCF) CFO informally met with Yahoo chief Scott Thompson last week to hammer out a deal - the first meeting between senior Yahoo and Alibaba execs since talks broke down in mid-February. Interestingly, Stifel mentioned earlier today that Yahoo and Alibaba are still talking, but failed to trigger a rally.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • CHSI

    Credit Suisse says Catalyst Health's (CHSI +4.4%) pharmacy benefit management contract win with...

    Credit Suisse says Catalyst Health's (CHSI +4.4%) pharmacy benefit management contract win with Regence Rx is a positive, and validates its Now program. Shares are currently rated Outperform with a $69 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • UTHR

    Argus lines up United Therapeutics (UTHR -1.4%) as an undervalued name in the healthcare sector,...

    Argus lines up United Therapeutics (UTHR -1.4%) as an undervalued name in the healthcare sector, as it maintains a Buy rating on the biotech concern. Analysts with the firm expect Argus to hit its 2012 sales target, as they raise their price target on shares by $8 to $60.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • PCXCQ

    Coal stocks are weak today, after Sterne Agee says they see a nonexistent market for spot and...

    Coal stocks are weak today, after Sterne Agee says they see a nonexistent market for spot and near-term coal prices as utilities continue to wrestle with unexpected generation declines, and to expect more production cuts for the industry: Patriot Coal (PCX -3.3%), Peabody Energy (BTU -5.4%) and Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -4.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • FFIV

    F5 Networks (FFIV -2%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at McAdams Wright Ragen, which notes...

    F5 Networks (FFIV -2%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy at McAdams Wright Ragen, which notes shares are up more than 80% since their upgrade in August and shares reflect full value. But the firm adds that barring a negative shift in the global economic landscape, business trends for F5 should remain robust in the near- to mid-term.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • DRIV-OLD

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD -4.7%) slips after RBC Capital downgraded the stock to Sector Perform,...

    Digital River (DRIV-OLD -4.7%) slips after RBC Capital downgraded the stock to Sector Perform, citing concerns over its evolving business model and an inconsistent growth profile.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • CHSI

    Catalyst Health Solutions (CHSI +3.9%) raises its full-year revenue guidance after reporting it...

    Catalyst Health Solutions (CHSI +3.9%) raises its full-year revenue guidance after reporting it was selected as exclusive provider of pharmacy benefit management services for a unit of Cambia Health. Oppenheimer commends the agreement, noting it may put CHSI on track to exceed its 2013 goal of doubling new business from last year's $400M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • CCO

    Clear Channel Outdoor (CCO +1.6%) gains after Caris upgraded the stock earlier today to Above...

    Clear Channel Outdoor (CCO +1.6%) gains after Caris upgraded the stock earlier today to Above Average on valuation. The firm lowers its price target however, to $11 from $12.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM

  • Down big today, silver catches a bit of a bid following the earthquake in Mexico as several...

    Down big today, silver catches a bit of a bid following the earthquake in Mexico as several mines are in the area. Silver -3.1% to $31.94.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • JASO

    Jefferies warns that the U.S. decision to set a tariff on imported solar panels shouldn't be...

    Jefferies warns that the U.S. decision to set a tariff on imported solar panels shouldn't be lighting a fire under solar stocks such as JA Solar (JASO +3.8%), Yingli Green Energy (YGE +13.9%), Trina Solar (TSL +7.9%), and Suntech Power (STP +9.9%). Analysts with the firm note that a more significant ruling on anti-dumping charges is not set to be released until May 17.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • BAC

    Despite Bank of America's (BAC +3.2%) latest denial of any capital-raising plans, WSJ's David...

    Despite Bank of America's (BAC +3.2%) latest denial of any capital-raising plans, WSJ's David Reilly thinks Brian Moynihan will need to consider taking advantage of BofA's recent share-price strength. "As painful as dilution is, the bank would still be highly geared to a U.S. economic recovery... a stronger balance sheet could actually put more wind under the stock's wings."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 6 Comments
  • STP

    Chinese solar stocks fly off of the news that the U.S. will slap tariffs on solar panels...

    Chinese solar stocks fly off of the news that the U.S. will slap tariffs on solar panels imported from China at a lower rate than was expected. The tariffs - set at 2.9% to 4.73% - are a reaction to subsidies the U.S. government says China gave to manufacturers. Advancers: STP +7.4%, JASO +1.7%, TSL +6.2%, YGE +12.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • WMB

    Williams (WMB +2.9%) and 72%-owned Williams Partners (WPZ -2.3%) head in opposite directions...

    Williams (WMB +2.9%) and 72%-owned Williams Partners (WPZ -2.3%) head in opposite directions after the latter agrees to acquire Caiman Eastern Midstream for $2.5B with the help of a $1B investment from the former, and both companies announce dividend hikes (I, II). Wells Fargo praises the deal for strengthing Williams' footprint in the Marcellus Shale. Meanwhile, Williams says it's still on the lookout for acquisition targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • ADBE

    Following yesterday's FQ1 report (I, II), Adobe (ADBE -4.3%) receives an upgrade to Sector...

    Following yesterday's FQ1 report (I, II), Adobe (ADBE -4.3%) receives an upgrade to Sector Perform from RBC, and a downgrade to the same rating from Pac Crest. The former is pleased with Adobe's transition to a subscription-based model, while the latter is worried about soft Creative Suite sales ahead of CS6's arrival. Piper, meanwhile, is optimistic CS6 demand will be strong. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • RCON

    Recon Technology (RCON +92%) shares nearly double after announcing yesterday it had successfully...

    Recon Technology (RCON +92%) shares nearly double after announcing yesterday it had successfully used a fracking technique developed by Baker Hughes (BHI) to complete a project at a field being developed by Sinopec (NYSE:SNP). RCON also said it had an additional $4.75M in signed contracts on its order books for H1 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • KND

    Shares of Kindred Healthcare (KND -6.4%) trade lower after Jefferies tags the company with a...

    Shares of Kindred Healthcare (KND -6.4%) trade lower after Jefferies tags the company with a lower price target of $11. Analysts say that although recent contract wins strengthen Kindred's government relations, they will only add pennies to earnings per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • DOLE

    Dole Food (DOLE -8.5%) gives back almost all of Friday's gains after being downgraded to Neutral...

    Dole Food (DOLE -8.5%) gives back almost all of Friday's gains after being downgraded to Neutral on valuation earlier today at JPMorgan.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • DCTH

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +12.3%) pops after receiving its first order for its...

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +12.3%) pops after receiving its first order for its chemosaturation-therapy delivery system from the European Institute of Oncology - a major European cancer treatment and research center.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • CA

    CA (CA -1.4%) shares are cut to Sector Perform at RBC Capital on valuation after a 37% YTD...

    CA (CA -1.4%) shares are cut to Sector Perform at RBC Capital on valuation after a 37% YTD run following last quarter's dividend raise. The firm had upgraded the stock at the time for the potential change in CA’s capital structure, but the dividend bump satisfied that reason, and a further material dividend hike isn’t likely.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • VECO

    CLSA cuts its rating on LED equipment maker Veeco (VECO -6.8%) to Sell, citing increased...

    CLSA cuts its rating on LED equipment maker Veeco (VECO -6.8%) to Sell, citing increased downside risk once investors realize an order recovery is not just around the corner. The firm sees a V-shaped recovery as “highly unlikely” given the magnitude of sector over-investment in 2009-2011 and capital intensity compression expected in 2012. Also: AIXG -4.9%, CREE -3.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    The financial sector (XLF +0.2%) is the only positive performer in morning trade, coming after...

    The financial sector (XLF +0.2%) is the only positive performer in morning trade, coming after Jefferies (JEF +1.6%) reported better-than-expected fixed income and investment banking revenue in its FQ1. Bank of America (BAC +3.2%) led the group after it denied a rumor that it would issue shares in a secondary offering. Also: GS +2.3%, MS +2.1%, C +1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN +8.5%) spikes on heavy volume after the USPTO website posts an allowance for a...

    Amarin (AMRN +8.5%) spikes on heavy volume after the USPTO website posts an allowance for a formulation patent. Shares are now up 57% over the last 5 trading sessions in frenzied trading tied to patent news.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • XXIA

    Ixia (XXIA -11%) takes a hit after saying President and CEO Atul Bhatnagar will be leaving the...

    Ixia (XXIA -11%) takes a hit after saying President and CEO Atul Bhatnagar will be leaving the company and will not stand for reelection to the Board. Victor Alston has been appointed as his successor. Wunderlich downgrades the shares to Hold on the news, citing uncertainty in the transition. The firm keeps its price target unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -2.2%) is the Dow's top loser as renewed concerns about China's economic growth...

    Caterpillar (CAT -2.2%) is the Dow's top loser as renewed concerns about China's economic growth sparks a decline in shares of U.S. industrial companies (XLI -1.4%), and as CAT says its sales are rising in each of the world's regions but at a lower rate than in past months. Among other top industrials: JOYG -4.7%, CMI -4.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -4.3%) says chairman and founder Michael J. Quillen will retire...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -4.3%) says chairman and founder Michael J. Quillen will retire following the company's May 17 shareholder meeting, and will be succeeded by CEO Kevin S. Crutchfield. Shares are diving along with those of other coal miners (KOL -2.8%). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • INXN

    InterXion (INXN +2.8%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Wells...

    InterXion (INXN +2.8%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Wells Fargo, citing the company's data center expansion initiatives and potential for accelerating revenue growth in late 2013. The firm also raises its price target range to $19 - $20 from $17 - $18.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • GMAN

    Gordmans Stores (GMAN +17.4%) jumps higher after beating estimates with its Q4 earnings report...

    Gordmans Stores (GMAN +17.4%) jumps higher after beating estimates with its Q4 earnings report and guiding estimates for Q1 higher. The company now sees EPS of $0.40-$0.41 on revenue of $132M-$133M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • ARO

    Shares of Aeropostale (ARO +1.2%) perk up on speculation that the retailer could be a takeover...

    Shares of Aeropostale (ARO +1.2%) perk up on speculation that the retailer could be a takeover candidate.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • OVTI

    Needham thinks the 62% YTD rally in OmniVision (OVTI +1.6%) has more room to run, upgrading...

    Needham thinks the 62% YTD rally in OmniVision (OVTI +1.6%) has more room to run, upgrading shares to Buy from Hold with a $24 price target. Teardowns of the new iPad find OVTI supplying both the 5 MP back camera and VGA front camera, which the firm says is consistent with above-consensus guidance. Checks also point to increased capacity with Taiwan Semi.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow the rest of the world lower on concerns about China's...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures follow the rest of the world lower on concerns about China's growth after BHP issues a warning about iron ore demand from the country, with the S&P benchmark -0.6%. Following earnings, Tiffany's is +4.5% but Adobe is -4.4%. Later: Fed's Bernanke, Kocherlakota, Oracle FQ3
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • FRO

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO) -5.9% premarket after shares are downgraded to Underperform at Wells Fargo,...

    Frontline (NYSE:FRO) -5.9% premarket after shares are downgraded to Underperform at Wells Fargo, which believes the "recent short squeeze" - FRO is up 69% in the past 10 trading days, vs. S&P up 5% - has taken valuation "well beyond a sustainable level... particularly given the fact that there has been little-to-no change in FRO’s long-term fundamentals."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 2 Comments
  • ANF

    Abercrombie and Fitch (NYSE:ANF) is seen as a potential LBO target following bullish options...

    Abercrombie and Fitch (NYSE:ANF) is seen as a potential LBO target following bullish options activity, Bloomberg speculates. Cowen thinks the teen retailer could get $70/share in a takeover, and Morningstar says ANF boasts strong free cash flow while remaining relatively debt-free - "It's got all the characteristics you like to see" in an LBO. ANF +2.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • FMCN

    Premarket gainers: FMCN +8%. ZLCS +7%. WMB +4%. KORS +4%. TIF +4%.Losers: TRGT -16%. JASO -9%....

    Premarket gainers: FMCN +8%. ZLCS +7%. WMB +4%. KORS +4%. TIF +4%.
    Losers: TRGT -16%. JASO -9%. FRO -6%. RGP -5%. ADBE -4%. GEN -4%. ALV -4%. RIO -4%. IRE -3%. MT -3%. BHP -3%. CLF -3%. AKS -3%. SDRL -3%. S -3%. ING -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • DPZ

    Bank of America weighs in on Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) after digesting the impact of the firm's...

    Bank of America weighs in on Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) after digesting the impact of the firm's $3 special dividend payout. Analysts downgrade to Underperform from Neutral, saying that the anticipation of the dividend drove the stock to lofty valuations that can't be sustained now. Shares -1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • CBIO

    Targacept (TRGT) -15% premarket after the antidepressant it was testing with AstraZeneca...

    Targacept (TRGT) -15% premarket after the antidepressant it was testing with AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN) failed in its last two late-stage studies, ending plans to seek regulatory approval. The two companies said on Dec. 20 the drug hadn’t met its target in a late-stage trial, and the latest failure was the final of four trials on the therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) +21.9% premarket after receiving a Notice of Allowance from the U.S....

    Galena Biopharma (GALE) +21.9% premarket after receiving a Notice of Allowance from the U.S. patent office for a patent covering the use of its NeuVax product candidate, a vaccine for inducing immunity to breast cancer recurrence in some patients. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • LGF.A

    Momentum continues in shares of Lions Gate (LGF) in anticipation of the March 23 release of The...

    Momentum continues in shares of Lions Gate (LGF) in anticipation of the March 23 release of The Hunger Games, expected to gross $115M in its opening U.S. weekend and looking poised to propel the independent filmmaker into the orbit of Hollywood heavyweights. LGF, up 7.9% yesterday in hitting a 52-week high, +3.8% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • JASO

    More on JA Solar's (NASDAQ:JASO) Q4: Shipments fell to 398MW from 445MW in Q3. Achieved positive...

    More on JA Solar's (NASDAQ:JASO) Q4: Shipments fell to 398MW from 445MW in Q3. Achieved positive operating cash flow of $86.6M for the quarter. Intends to maintain its annualized solar cell capacity at 2.8GW in 2012. Shares -3.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • ANIP

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) announces positive results from studies of its Pill-Plus oral...

    BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) announces positive results from studies of its Pill-Plus oral contraceptive. The company is line to receive royalty payments on sales of Pill-Plus if it's eventually introduced in the U.S. Shares +14.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • GE

    Moody's warns that the debt rating on GE Capital may be cut below that of parent GE due to a...

    Moody's warns that the debt rating on GE Capital may be cut below that of parent GE due to a change in its rating methodology. The ratings agency says that new parameters now factor in the higher risks associated with finance companies. Shares -0.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • HOG

    BMO Capital raises its rating on Harley-Davidson (NYSE:HOG) to Outperform from Market Perform on...

    BMO Capital raises its rating on Harley-Davidson (NYSE:HOG) to Outperform from Market Perform on its take that early season sales are "robust" for the motorcycle maker. The firm also lifts its price target on HOG all the way up to $60 from $39. Shares +0.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM
